Posts.Content: I was just thinking how life gets turned upside down so quickly, one minute I was planning christmas the next coping with numerous hospital appointments and the life changes that cancer brings on.Its only now a few weeks after my MX that my head/mind has caught up.In such a short space of time I have had to learn all about my type of cancer, cope with waiting for results game, cope with pain, and dealing with other people upset over my condition. I'm looking forward to planning next christmas when I hope life returns back to normal again x
Posts.Title: Everythings happens so quickly ..

Posts.Content: How wonderful you have a baby son congratulations,my grandaughter is 4 weeks old today Scarlett Marie she's beautiful. I got diagnosed 2 days before she was born and her birth proved a great distraction for me. Your emotions must be all over the place phew ! It wont always be this bad , try and think about the day you and your lovely son will play in the sunshine and what fun you will have.Sending you a big hug x
Posts.Title: Coping with cancer treatment AND young kids!

Posts.Content: Thank goodness I'm not alone ! I'm onto Radiotherapy now , had the neccessary bits chopped off, had the poison poured into my veins, then the neutropenic stays in hospital, now the frying ,soon the tamoixfen and even if I do say so myself handled (most of it) with a big brave smile, I worried about how my children and family would handle it so I stayed brave until now. I could easily be a wreck but I dare not shown any emotion because if I did I would scream the house down ! I'm so so tired , I hate the constant trips to the hospital, last week got told I had lymphoedema, this week a glucose intolerance  next week will my big toe drop off ? I hate the person I am with my lovely husband. There's no way around it CANCER SUCKS ! I'm looking forward to having all this behind me and like you beevergirl getting back to been someone worth been around. Sending you a big hug xx
Posts.Title: out of control and scared

Posts.Content: Many thanks, I guess I am been nosey but I have been told so little and after all it is 'Me' they are writing about. Take Care Amanda
Posts.Title: Patient Notes

Posts.Content: I had my first consultation with the lymphoedema nurse today , she was reading out my notes and I learnt lots of things that no one had told me about, like a high level of seroma found by my CT scan, ‘skin sparing’ had happened during my operation , level 3 in lymph nodes, issues over blood problem  etc  etc. I just feel now that I would like to have a read but not sure how I go about it.
Posts.Title: Patient Notes

Posts.Content: Out of everything in this world a dog gives the best hugs and love !
Posts.Title: I have just upset the dog

Posts.Content: Well done ! Sometimes the biggest test is just walking through the door of the chemo unit, I 'm 4 down two to go! Strange but I missed my red pee! Just changed drugs on friday on FEC x3 /T x3. I'm still surviving although treat myself to a day in bed today. I have also had a few problems with my central line, its been in three weeks and still a little sore with a dead top arm and back ? I'm sure it will pass. Keep positive Caz xxx
Posts.Title: 1 down 5 to go:))

Posts.Content: After seven weeks I still feel like I have a couple of broken ribs, i think its all part and parcel of having the M/X and expander. Hope it gets better for you x
Posts.Title: anyone experienced painful ribs post Mx?

Posts.Content: I feel such empathy with your message, I have just finished my radiotherapy and I have a 'spooky' month off all appointments ( well major ones anyway ). I never thought I would reach the end of this journey and if I never hear or see anything to do with Cancer again will still be to soon lol.  But this website has been my lifeline. So grateful to Macmillian for it and because it helped me so such I will still be reading and adding my twopenth worth ! and of course my occasional moans... er ... did I tell you ?  I'm still sore after radiotherapy LOL Love Amanda
Posts.Title: Living again

Posts.Content: I have just discovered The Haven ! Thank you Thank you ....  I bet everyone here has already heard of the 3 centres based in Leeds, Hereford and London . If you do live near one of the centres give it a try , its soley based for breast cancer and I have been booked in for several helpful therapys , counselling and a full day where I will get to meet other people with the same problems as me andi get to learn about healing techniques. A lovely peaceful, calm place. http://www.thehaven.org.uk/ Although Beware ! During one of my many hot flushes I used one of their tissues to dab myself with and got covered in little pieces of tissue, yep all over my face, neck and chest , thankfully I realised before I got on the train home !!! Love to everyone Amanda
Posts.Title: The Haven Breast Centre Support Centres

Posts.Content: Hi Jen My side effects were severe hot flushes to the point I would feel faint, night sweats which meant I had to change my clothes 2-3 times a night, terrible headaches, joint pain in particular my knee and wrists. low mood, vision problems that I found it hard to drive comfortably. The major problem was pins and neddles in my arms,palpitations and chest pain I honestly thought I was having a heart attack . I was even more concerned as I had a stroke three months before the breast cancer.
Posts.Title: Tamoxifin

Posts.Content: I stopped taking Tamoxifen three months ago, I really struggled with severe hot flushes, night sweats,pin and needles in my arms, tireness and much more. I started to have palpitations and chest pains my oncologists suggested I stop taking it , he said it would only have helped any outcome by 5% ( they can do the stats) . The quality of my life has vastly improved , I feel 'normal' and positive again, I had been on Tamoxifen for 5 mths everyone is different but ask the people who know about these tablets and their side effects your daughter's doctors. But also I don't think you daughter would come off the tablets if her side effects weren't causing her alot of distress. I hope this helps you x
Posts.Title: Tamoxifin

Posts.Content: I like to think of myself as 2 thirds of the way through my treatment Yeah! Although if I'm honest this last third is been tricky. But on reflection after just finding out about the red traffic light of BC I would like to have said to my friends and family...... Today I may feel like crap, tomorrow I might feel great, I might want you to be supportive, I might want you to just go away and leave me alone, today I may not feel like wearing my make-up so I look 'less ill', but tomorrow I might wear bright red, I dont know how I feel about you 'praying for me' cos that's just not me but I do know that you are trying to show me you care and sometimes I just can't handle people, friends, family been kind or nice or horrid to me. Because I have no idea how to handle this either . Does that make any sense ? Love to you all x
Posts.Title: friends and family freaking me out :(

Posts.Content: Can I just ask a question which seems a little rude to ask but how are other sufferers of this annoying illness coping within their relationship i.e. partners. My husband and I have only been married five years and sadly in the last year I have had an unsuccessful knee replacement, followed only weeks later by a serious stroke which thankfully I have made a full recovery from and then only a few months later breast cancer. The strained on our relationship has become unbearable, we are argue constantly, sniping then we tip toe around each other not daring to upset the other. It’s awful and the stress on top of the cancer is just too depressing for me.I try and be upbeat about everything but I have been hospitalised on 6 occasions and my lovely partner has felt I guess guilty as on 2 occasions I had to ring for help as I was unable to wake him. We have been sleeping separately for some time, so I think you can guess what else as has fallen by the wayside. I have no inclination to have sex but my partner still does. (I know too much information!) it’s got to the point where we rarely kiss or cuddle. I just wondered has anyone else had similar problems. Is there somewhere can we go for help. We love each other dearly but the strained is enormous. Sorry if this is very forward Amanda x
Posts.Title: Relationships and cancer

Posts.Content: I have not started my hormone treatment yet, I had a stroke last year and I know tamoxifen can increase the chance of this happening again plus gaining even more hot flushes so I have made an appointment with my GP just to discuss this and all my meds. The hot flushes started when had the last 3 sessions of chemo Taxotere.
Posts.Title: Hot Sweats and radiotherapy !

Posts.Content: I just wondered if anyone like me is still struggling with the hot flushes and night sweats, I have been having acupuncture for the hot flushes but only 2 sessions so far. I started the radiotherapy this week and was told to moisturise the affected area but keep the skin as dry as possible. But my hot flushes mean that I’m dripping with sweat most of the time so any creams are just slipping off, I had my Hickman line removed 3 weeks ago, it was always infected and the area was always very sore but now this is the area been treat to radiotherapy and the scar from the line is red raw, my removed breast has always felt numb as does the area under my arm ( I had 41 lymph nodes removed) is that the same for everyone ? Will I ever be able to feel under my arm or my missing breast area? I would ask at my radiotherapy appointment but everyone there is so busy and business like, one nurse said everything will be explained at the review sessions but that’s a week away. Thanks amanda
Posts.Title: Hot Sweats and radiotherapy !

Posts.Content: I am on the lovely Tamoxifen drug been taking it for 4 mths and really struggling with the hot flushes and night sweats. My GP suggested taking Black Cohosh which I bought from Holland and Barratt, I have just been checking out the internet and it say don't take it if you have oestrogen dependant tumour. Any thoughts ?
Posts.Title: Hot flushes

Posts.Content: I know that there's no excuse but I forgot what a dreadful, horrid shock this was for my husband. I lost my breast and lymph nodes on fri 13th. Following the operation and whilst I was in hospital he was of no use at all totally in a daze. The first night home he didnt make me any tea, I had to ring for take-away, the house was in such a mess I just cried.After 3 days I said that i felt I should stay at my mother's until I got better than all of a sudden he cried, such fear of losing me and our way of life that we had led. So all I'm saying its can be just as hard for our partners as us. Not forgetting children and extended family .
Posts.Title: Husband response - not that interested?!

Posts.Content: Hiya Michele I would love to tell you that you won't lose your hair, I met a lovely lady who had kept her hair using the cold cap but she has Ovarian cancer and I think thats different chemo ? Her hair was very thick and curly and apprently that helps. I was told I would lose mine for def so I just went for it. The hair started to fall out about 14 days after the first chemo and you know I love my wig, it takes me alot less time to get ready on a morning, I would spend hours drying and straightening. the only thing is the hot flushes and wearing a wig phew ! not easy. I was fine until my eyebrow and lashes went but that wasn't until 4th Tax, I'm just about to finished my radiotherapy and desperately hoping my eyelashes come back soon.,  I hope your journey through chemo goes well and quickly passes xxxx
Posts.Title: FEC and hair loss

Posts.Content: What happened to Dorothy happened to me too with the neutrophils, mine went to 0.01 at one stage but by then I was on my third day sat in my hosp bed.I went into hospital several times and had my chemo adjusted each time. Its better to have a good blood count before having your chemo or you certainly will regret it . Plans ? what are plans I gave up with them months ago but life gets back to some sort of normal for me next week last of the radiotherapy coming up yippeee! Take good care of yourself xx
Posts.Title: Low Neutrophils

Posts.Content: I had my last chemo 3rd July ( three weeks on fri) I'm competely zapped of all energy, breathless. hot flushes, night sweats. I have the lovely radiotherapy to come yet. Like you I have had infection after infection, got the antibiotics which brought on the thrush etc etc. I did get checked for netropenia ( had it four times during treatment) but apprently my blood was normal ?. So I guess we have to take it easy and enjoy the better days..... my husband has been fab too which just makes me feel more guiltly xx Soon be over I hope x
Posts.Title: Fatigue and pain

Posts.Content: Thank you its nice to know someone is out there xx
Posts.Title: Not sure where I belong anymore

Posts.Content: Hello, At christmas time this year I knew my cancer had returned, i had such neck and back ache tireness that I tried my hardness to fight. My daughter was getting married in June and I was so determined that she had a lovely day. I had been to the GP alot I had a bad cough that wont go away and pains in my neck but nothing wrong with me except arthritus. It was getting worse in May I gave up my degree course, there was just no way I could continue, 5 times up till then at the GP's. I phoned my oncologist please please do something about the pain, i was finally booked in for a bone scan. The bone scan confirmed several areas of cancer throughout the spine but not the neck. I told the oncologist i could hardly move my neck he said no problem with your neck its refferred pain.CT scan was order as a precaution and I was told to return in 2 months when a treatment plan would be explained. Three weeks later i was told to go to clinic immeadiately so I was there 9.30 am next morning where i was rushed into a neck brace and told i was to have an emergency operation to fuse my c1-4 vertebras together as cancer has eaten it way through and my neck was in danger of collaspe. I asked for them to give me a full story of what is going on, he replied he wasnt sure yet and he needed to refer me to another consultant but that in 2 days I was to have a major operation. I got out of hospital  totally bewilled yes I definely have secondary bone cancer 'throughout my spine ' but i know nothing more. I do not have any follow up appointments, i have phoned the breast care nurses, oncology team and left a message for one of the breast cancer consultant and within the last 2 weeks i have heard nothing.  I feel like I am dying my pain and now that of my newly operated neck is awful, i am taking morphine. If theses are to be my last weeks, days, months then I want to know so that i can plan , enjoy or just be. Does anyone know what I can do? I have never joined a support group but i notice theres one at my local hospital this tuesday Im sorry about the grammar and spelling trying to think clearly through morphine doses.
Posts.Title: Not sure where I belong anymore

Posts.Content: I had a CT scan for a heart problem back at the begining of November , it shown cancer . The scan was followed with Mammogram, Ultrasound, then a MRI before i was told about mid December it was Invasive Lobular breast cancer grade 2b which had spread into the lymph nodes. My operation is 13th Jan I delayed it by a week as I going to have a great hoilday before all this kicks in. I dont know how long anyone should wait be its been over 2 months for me. Or if you count the 6 weeks (end of sept before) when i went to my Gp and she told me it was nothing ! Lobular cancer i have been told is very hard to find, then grade and then to know the best way to operate. You know we have enough to worry about at the minute so just trust that your consultant knows what he is doing. I also wonder if everything slows down for Christmas. Here's hoping for successful operations for the both of us.
Posts.Title: Still no surgery (invasive lobular grade 2)

Posts.Content: I got told by my holistic centre at the hospital to try out this website Anna Bandana, I was amazed at the prices and according to the centre the hear gear is all good quality. Shame I just paid £36 for one scarf ! http://www.annabandana.co.uk/ Love Amanda
Posts.Title: Reasonable priced Scarves and Hats

Posts.Content: Thats the fun of chemo... just when you think you got it sussed out it does somthing new !There's no controlling it ,We are just going along for the ride liek a big dipper or rollercoaster. I think you should give yourself a big chocolate or alcohol treat just for been able to work during chemo and look after your daughter well I think your Superwoman, I'm whacked most of the time, started knitting squares for a blanket that how exciting my life is lol. I did do some gardening today hurrah ! Sending your blood a big hug !
Posts.Title: chemo delayed a week ..so upset

Posts.Content: Oh how wonderful !  Im so looking forward to my last chemo, I have two more to go ( FECx3/Taxofen x3 ) the last Taxofen has been very hard work, but in all I have been admitted five times, had a hickman line inserted , had 3 infections and gone neutropenic 4 times.... so bring on the last on the chemo lol. Good job I have a sense of humour ! Bad news has been I have lost not a drop in weight argh!
Posts.Title: last of treatment on tuesday

Posts.Content: Hello Irene I have been neutropenic on both of my two treatments, first after 6 days following the treatment, I was in hospital for 5 days given antibotics and injections to increase levels. i did have an oral thrush infection quite bad and yes they did delay the next round of treatment by a week. On my second treatment, neutropenic after 5 days back in hospital for 6 days on IV antibotics but no sign of infection and my chemo went ahead as planned about 10 days later. So it might well depend on whether you get an infection or not. I'm surprised you have not been admitted though. Had my third treatment 6 days ago and so far so good although chronic constipation is driving me mad ! Good luck to you and hope you have a fab break ! Amanda
Posts.Title: neutropenia

Posts.Content: Hiya , I was just wondering if anyone has had problems with the expanders? I had 100mm lobular cancer and 41 lymph nodes removed and at the same time had an expander fitted. I appreciate that it was a big operation but the expander has been so uncomfortable, I feel like I have broken ribs. I had some fluid build up below the expander which hasnt helped and my consultant does not want to remove the fluid but to remove the expander instead ( next thurs) If i had known how painful the expander was going to be I would not have had it fitted, everyone is different but just wondered if anyone else has had the same problem?
Posts.Title: Anyone had expander problems ?

Posts.Content: Thank you for the advice, I love fruit and juices so have started a fruit fest ! I did have a tablespoon full of Olive Oil which seems to have done the trick although it would have tasted better if I was sat on a beach in the Med ! love to you all Amanda
Posts.Title: neutropenia

Posts.Content: I thought I was fine, I got to my last Tax still no problems then 3 days later both thumb nails started to turn yellow and lift, now five weeks later one has gone and the other is quickly following suit. Don't use false nails to makes them definately lift !! Spoke to two other women on the ward and both had used false nails and lost several nails which lifted off when the false nail were removed . On my last week of radiotherapy soon be over at times I never thought it would be x
Posts.Title: Black nail varnish & Docetaxel
